rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0001
rows.name:
Hey... Gramps,
you were guarding this place
all this time, weren't you?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0002
rows.name: That's right. For 500 years.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0003
rows.name:
But you know, when I was a kid
living in Iyasaki village, you never
seemed to be doing anything like that.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0004
rows.name:
Because things have been fairly
peaceful for the past 300 years.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0005
rows.name:
In human society, once 200 years have
passed, things start turning into legends
or get treated as fictional events.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0006
rows.name:
Long ago, Drivers used to come in here,
but their numbers dwindled over time.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0007
rows.name:
Moreover, unless one is born
in Liberalitas, the entrance
to this place won't open.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0008
rows.name:
Unfortunately, Iyasaki village's
population has been slowly declining.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0009
rows.name:
The number of people aware
of this place continues
to diminish.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0010
rows.name: I see...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0011
rows.name:
So you were actually doing
important work back then, Gramps.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0012
rows.name:
I still am, aren't I!?
I was the one who informed you about
this place, wasn't I!?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0013
rows.name: Yeah, yeah...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0014
rows.name:
Really, Nia is just like Correl
when she was young.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0015
rows.name: Huh?! Really?!

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0016
rows.name:
Somehow,
it doesn't feel like a compliment...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0017
rows.name:
She was quite lively too.
She actually came in here
when she was a child.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0018
rows.name: Pretty courageous...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0019
rows.name:
Well, she did turn back at the bridge.
She must have sensed that this was
a frightening place.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0020
rows.name:
Well, it's beyond the Guardian Deity's
domain after all. Anyone raised in
Iyasaki village would feel that way.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0021
rows.name:
Fear and respect go hand in hand...
There's even a term, 'awe',
that combines both concepts.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0022
rows.name:
Everyone from Iyasaki village
understands the importance
of this place instinctively.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0023
rows.name: What should I say?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0024
rows.name: That's all because of you, Gramps.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0025
rows.name: How would outsiders feel about it?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0101
rows.name:
You've been guarding this place for ages,
haven't you?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0102
rows.name:
I believe the villagers of Iyasaki
respect the Guardian so much because
you've been there all this time.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0103
rows.name:
You're right. This place's
significance can only be maintained
if someone is there to pass it on.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0104
rows.name:
Without the Divine Beast Seiryuu,
this place might have been
completely forgotten.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0105
rows.name:
I've never been told such
a thing until now...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0106
rows.name:
You've done a great job
these past 500 years.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0107
rows.name: Yeah. Good job, Gramps.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0109
rows.name: What I'm deeply thinking now is...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0110
rows.name:
How grateful I am to be able to
journey with Rex and everyone
in this smaller form.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0111
rows.name:
If I had stayed in my larger form,
I couldn't have come here and
heard what you just said...!!

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0112
rows.name:
And here I thought I'd hear
something more profound!
Is that all?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0113
rows.name: Hohoho!

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0201
rows.name: People from outside of Iyasaki village?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0202
rows.name:
None have entered in recent years, but
400 years ago, visitors did sometimes
venture in here with Iyasaki youths.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0203
rows.name:
As you might expect,
outsiders view this place as nothing
more than another ancient ruin.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0204
rows.name:
I attempted to reason with them
at the entrance, but they wouldn't
listen to me.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0205
rows.name:
But I never went as far as
fighting to prevent them
from entering.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0206
rows.name:
It's not like they could make it
all the way to the end anyway...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0207
rows.name:
As a result,
there were more and more adventurers
who never came back.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0208
rows.name:
But perhaps because of those foolhardy
adventurers, this place came to be viewed
with a proper sense of reverence.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0209
rows.name:
A place where no one returns
after entering? Of course people
would find that terrifying.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0210
rows.name:
Certainly, there is also
that aspect to it.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0211
rows.name:
So you've been here for 500 years,
seeing all this happen, haven't you?

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0212
rows.name: It must have been pretty tough...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0213
rows.name: Sorry for making light remarks earlier...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0214
rows.name: Don't worry about it, Nia.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0215
rows.name: I understand your sharp tongue very well.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0216
rows.name:
And the fact that you're
actually kind-hearted.

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0217
rows.name: Ugh...

rows.label: kizunatalk024_msg0218
rows.name:
I want to say something back,
but I can't right now...!
